stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Phishing Email with Office Monkeys Theme Leads to Malware
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description:
On 3 July 2014, a phishing email was sent from juliecarr73@bellsouth.net with the subject "FW: :))))" and a link to the malicious archive Monkeys LOL Video.zip on the online storage service Dropbox. The malware payload, Office_Monkeys.exe (MD5: 95b3ec0a4e539efaa1faa3d4e25d51de), called back to www.sanjosemaristas.com.
According to a third party report, this file was also used in a campaign that targeted DIB contractors and US Government users in September 2014. The campaign referenced the "office monkeys" from the Career Builder television commercials.

boundary="----=_NextPart_000_00DD_01CF96D3.9543AD20" X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook 14.0 Thread-Index: Ac+XDhcMQvxI6ThzRnW0HsRD9/tl2Q== Content-Language: en-us ---- END EMAIL HEADER ----
---- BEGIN EMAIL BODY ---- LOOOL!!!!!! awesome this is really funny!!
Best Regards,
[REDACTED SENDER FIRST NAME]
From: [REDACTED] Sent: Thursday, July 03, 2014 9:54 AM To: juliecarr73@bellsouth.net Subject: :))))
ROFL J https://www.dropbox.com/s/y7akc0p5qwqf67r/Office%20Monkeys%20LOL%20Video.zip
Best,
[REDACTED FIRST NAME] ________________________________________
[REDACTED NAME] Research Analyst [REDACTED] ---- END EMAIL BODY ----

The executable contained within the .zip file on Dropbox is a self-extracting .rar archive. When executed, it creates Monkeys.exe and player.exe in the %UserProfileAppdata%\Local\Temp location, then executes these files.

Monkeys.exe seems to read in information from itself and then player.exe performs the subsequent installation.
The comment below contains SFX script commands in the %UserProfileAppData%\Roaming\ATI_Subsystem\ directory:
Path=%TEMP% Setup=%TEMP%\Monkeys.exe Setup=%TEMP%\player.exe Silent=1 Overwrite=1
amdhcp32.dll atiumdag.dll aticaldd.dll racss.dat amdocl_as32.exe (This is a legitimate Rundll32.exe file responsible for the traffic)
It then executes amdocl_as32.exe
CMD C:\Users\sharkpanda\AppData\Roaming\ATI_Subsystem\amdocl_as32.exe C:\Users\sharkpanda\AppData\Roaming\ATI_Subsystem\atiumdag.dll, ADL2_ApplicationProfiles_System_Reload 3648
This results in a command prompt being created and issuing a Taskkill against the current PID number for player.exe
CMD /Q /C TASKKILL /F /PID 3648 > NUL & DEL /F /Q C:\Users\SHARKP~1\AppData\Local\Temp\player.exe > NUL
It will then proceed to make communication out to the designated command and control(C2).

This file was identified as a supporting 32-bit DLL payload.
Import Hash: 4fcca208e21237d4a38b26f2461938ce Date: 0x53B475F4 [Wed Jul 2 21:13:24 2014 UTC] EP: 0x100016f3 .text 0/4 CRC: Claimed: 0x19af8, Actual: 0x19af8 Compile Timestamp: 2014-07-02 17:13:24 Section Hashes: .text c63d5a0e405625a824f5cd498f7dae25 .rdata b65b64ca311f66a4705c1ee584e8a3a8 .data 28547ea51f1dce81ebf915c8efecfbf5 .reloc aefa0501f2dca88c0caf05445444834c
